- "Schindler's List" (1993) - This classic war film tells the story of Oskar Schindler, a German businessman who saves more than 600 Jews from Nazi death camps during World War II. The film received widespread critical acclaim and was honored with several awards including four Academy Awards for Best Picture, Best Director, Best Original Screenplay, Best Film Editing; three Golden Globes for Best Motion Picture - Drama, Best Director - Drama, Best Screenplay - drama; and one BAFTA Award for Best Art Direction - Color. It has also been included in numerous lists of great films including the American Film Institute's (AFI's) 100 Greatest Films, The New York Times' (NYT's') Top 100 Movies Ever Made, Time Magazine's (TM's)) 100 Best Movies Ever Made, Rotten Tomatoes' (RTT's)) Top 250 movies ever made, Metacritic's (MC's)) Overall Score To Date for 1942 film Casablanca, and The New York Times' (NYT's')) Top 100 Movies Ever Made in 2008.
